edu.rit.util

Class BitSet32

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.BitSet32
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Streamable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitSet32Vbl

    public class BitSet32
extends Object
implements Streamable
    Class BitSet32 provides a set of integers from 0 to 31. The set elements are stored in a bitmap representation.

    The bitmap representation is a value of type int. Bit 0 of the bitmap (the least significant bit) corresponds to set element 0, bit 1 of the bitmap (the next least significant bit) corresponds to set element 1, and so on. A bit of the bitmap is 1 if the set contains the corresponding element; a bit of the bitmap is 0 if the set does not contain the corresponding element.

    Note: Class BitSet32 is not multiple thread safe.

      • add

        public BitSet32 add(int elem)
        Add the given element to this set. If elem is not in the range 0 .. 31, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • add

        public BitSet32 add(int lb,
           int ub)
        Add all elements in the given range to this set. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are added to this set. If any element is not in the range 0 .. 31, that element is not added. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • remove

        Remove the given element from this set. If elem is not in the range 0 .. 31, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • remove

        public BitSet32 remove(int lb,
              int ub)
        Remove all elements in the given range from this set. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are removed from this set. If any element is not in the range 0 .. 31, that element is not removed. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • flip

        public BitSet32 flip(int elem)
        Flip the given element. If this set contains elem, it is removed; if this set does not contain elem, it is added. If elem is not in the range 0 .. 31, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        elem - Element.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • flip

        public BitSet32 flip(int lb,
            int ub)
        Flip all elements in the given range. All elements from lb through ub−1, inclusive, are flipped. If this set contains such an element, it is removed; if this set does not contain such an element, it is added. If any element is not in the range 0 .. 31, that element is not flipped. If lb ≥ ub, this set is unchanged.
        Parameters:
        lb - Lower bound element (inclusive).
        ub - Upper bound element (exclusive).
        Returns:
        This set.

      • isSubsetOf

        public boolean isSubsetOf(BitSet32 set)
        Determine if this set is a subset of the given set. This is so if every element of this set is also an element of the given set.
        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        True if this set is a subset of the given set, false otherwise.

      • union

        public BitSet32 union(BitSet32 set)
        Change this set to be the union of itself and the given set. The union consists of all elements that appear in this set or the given set or both.
        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • intersection

        public BitSet32 intersection(BitSet32 set)
        Change this set to be the intersection of itself and the given set. The intersection consists of all elements that appear in this set and the given set.
        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • difference

        public BitSet32 difference(BitSet32 set)
        Change this set to be the difference of itself and the given set. The difference consists of all elements that appear in this set and not in the given set.
        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • symmetricDifference

        public BitSet32 symmetricDifference(BitSet32 set)
        Change this set to be the symmetric difference of itself and the given set. The symmetric difference consists of all elements that appear in this set or the given set, but not both.
        Parameters:
        set - Set.
        Returns:
        This set.

      • forEachItemDo

        public void forEachItemDo(IntAction action)
        Perform the given action on each element in this set. For each element in this set from smallest to largest, the given action's run() method is called, passing in the element.

        Warning: If the action adds elements to or removes elements from the set, the forEachItemDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Parameters:
        action - Action.

      • forEachItemDo

        public <R> R forEachItemDo(IntActionResult<R> action)
        Perform the given action on each element in this set and return a result. For each element in this set from smallest to largest, the given action's run() method is called, passing in the element. After all the elements have been processed, the given action's result() method is called, and its result is returned.

        Warning: If the action adds elements to or removes elements from the set, the forEachItemDo() method's behavior is unspecified.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Result data type.
        Parameters:
        action - Action.
        Returns:
        Result of processing all the set elements.

      • removeEachItemIf

        public void removeEachItemIf(IntPredicate predicate)
        Evaluate the given predicate on, and possibly remove, each element in this set. For each element in this set from smallest to largest, the given predicate's test() method is called, passing in the element. If the test() method returns true, the element is removed from this set.

        Warning: If the predicate adds elements to or removes elements from the set, other than by returning true, the removeEachItemIf() method's behavior is not specified.

        Parameters:
        predicate - Predicate.
